meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a people.
meanings.sent1: The peoplehoods of the tribe were evident in their shared traditions.
meanings.sent2: The concept of peoplehoods is important in understanding cultural diversity.
meanings.sent3: The peoplehoods of the town were so strong that they all dressed up in matching outfits for the event.
meanings.sent4: In the melting pot of the city, different peoplehoods blended together to create a unique culture.
meanings.sent5: The sense of peoplehoods among the villagers was so strong that they always came together to help one another.

meanings.definition: The collective identity or consciousness of a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The shared history and values contribute to the peoplehoods of the community.
meanings.sent2: The celebration of cultural festivals strengthens the peoplehoods of the society.
meanings.sent3: The peoplehoods of the team were evident in their synchronized dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The peoplehoods of the nation resonated in the unity displayed during the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The sense of peoplehoods among the students was fostered through collaborative projects and activities.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a member of a particular group or community.
meanings.sent1: Belonging to the peoplehoods of the neighborhood brought a sense of security.
meanings.sent2: The sense of peoplehoods in the organization promoted teamwork and cooperation.
meanings.sent3: The peoplehoods of the club were so strong that they had secret handshakes.
meanings.sent4: The peoplehoods of the family were evident in their shared values and traditions.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the peoplehoods of the town meant participating in community events and gatherings.
